6RiW_tGEWZgNqvGxO_g3Ow.text: Great menu, the buffalo cauliflower taco is an off-the-wall smash. I suggest trying it all

UjIzUHVdAWxYP17e8ruVfQ.text: Best tacos in the Burgh! I'm from Chicago so my taco standards are pretty high. This place is amazing. Always fresh, generous portions. Awesome staff. Seating is limited to a counter so it's really a take it to go kinda place.

I-m42VNJ_Ku1kpP92i_SUQ.text: I've been very excited to try this place out after following their journey on Facebook. We ordered takeout for a group of 7, lots of different preferences with toppings, etc. Everything was correct, and they took the time to label the check and each meal with corresponding numbers so we could easily figure out which meals belonged to whom and how much money we owed. Specifically enjoyed the brisket taco and the hot sauce is incredible! Can't wait to make this a regular takeout spot and I'm so happy Bloomfield has a taco place!

tE1bJjHq7u3fkZG5caSMtQ.text: The veggie special sweet potato taco  loved the ambiance and neighborhood rapport. Treats you like family***** what a community spot. New favorite.

Vq_n3x7KppynUkT0liS2bg.text: For the first time on Yelp I have to review a restaurant solely based on their staff inconsistently showing up at the location.  The first time we got there during their posted hours and had to wait for them to show up and open the restaurant late(so unprofessional).  We didn't wait around and just decided to go to Thai Cuisine down the street.  The second time me and my lady made plans to go and decided to call first.  They said, sorry we are not open because we are doing a catering event.  I think this was the reason why they were late opening the first time.  I am never going there again.  First of all they have strange hours to begin with and second of all they can't even keep those hours.  Why bother going if you don't know if they will be open, or not?  You can't run a catering business with the same staff you run the restaurant with and expect to have regular hours.  It pisses me off because I do like the food.

q1xc6LojBk-XEUyvE1raDg.text: I had heard a lot of good things about Baby Loves Tacos so I was very excited to finally try. Upon arrival, we discovered that there weren't any tables so we ordered to go. I had the brisket, chicken, and chorizo tacos. My partner in crime had two vegetable tacos; which She liked. They were very tasty and the prices were good. The venue doesn't really have seating but you can stand and eat at the window. I look forward to coming back for the buffalo cauliflower and barbecue mushroom tacos. The service was fast and friendly. The brisket was my favorite so far. I give it a 4.5 and my co-diner gave it a 3.5.  Upon further review of a second trip, I have to bump my score up to a 5.0. The tacos were even better this time.

KJU_n2F_PK3f5PGH6YQegQ.text: It's my favorite. The bbq Mushroom and buffalo cauliflower are perfect. Some inconsistencies here and there, but nothing that decreases my luv for this place. Thank u bb luvs tacos

7QL8G9lho66FA7q7Uz1Ziw.text: 20/10!!!!!!  I loved their spicy brisket taco Owner and staff very nice and welcoming!

ywFr_VRrDD5Gx_FdW2dE8w.text: The people there are great. The food is five star just enough spice to give it a kick. Just counter space for dining in. It is in Bloomfield so parking is hit or miss.

27goeYn85b9u6T92wJyhJA.text: I have been hearing great things about this place since they opened and I finally tried it tonight and holy cow, it definitely lived up to the hype. The owner is v nice and even tho he was about to close when I popped in, he gave me the burrito he just made for himself, claiming it would be one of the best burritos I've ever had. I lived in Arizona for a while so my standards are high, but he wasn't toying with me. It was easily the best burrito I've had in Pittsburgh and possibly one of the best I've ever had. Not to mention the hot sauce was amazing. (Side note to owner: please open for breakfast, I've been craving a good breakfast burrito)

is2SkixVa5LbSUS3FnlIMQ.text: So much flavor! Doesn't matter what you order because it's always phenomenal. Owner is super awesome as well!

X_wucUBoaQre9aogxtQw8Q.text: Great addition to the neighborhood. Five stars for great fresh Mexican and awesome friendly service. Love the spicy brisket burrito!

ftFf5hCHdQSglNxh1fp8jw.text: Delicious tacos. A fun little spot that can get crowded. There's no seating, more of a grab and go but the tacos are great! I'd definitely recommend the spicy brisket. I could eat three of those. I've also tried the bbq mushroom and the chicken, both had great flavor. It doesn't get better than $10 for 3 tacos. Definitely kept me full.

wllevJCgzFeF2C9hHRYcwQ.text: Amazing tacos and burritos here. I had a chicken, brisket, and the vegetable of the day - sweet potato with feta and almonds. They were all amazing. Both my brother and boyfriend got spicy brisket burritos and they loved them! The owner and staff are also very friendly, which is always a plus!

tTBWu27reSzHh2XNi4fuEA.text: i got a rice bowl and there wasn't anything special about it. i got the buffalo cauliflower which was definitely a good choice - very different than what i've had before and it was very good! the rice bowl was mostly rice and it was uncooked... it would have been better if there was more of the other stuff. the worker was very nice and helpful though and they made the guac spicy which i also liked!

ugFvTa2unBh3h3biY0gwmA.text: Amazing tacos. Really unique and much needed taco place in Pittsburgh. Can't wait for it to officially open. The BLT taco is unreal

QiaPCk7vETK0W_E3gjDgwQ.text: That was the best breakfast burrito I've ever had. I thought long and hard about if that's True or not, and it totally is.

t0DGB6DqYIb9H_37ky-8IQ.text: I had BLT tonight at an offsite event. The tacos were PAY WHAT YOU CAN $$!! So cool. I am a vegetarian and enjoyed one of the buffalo cauliflower tacos and one potato and poblano. Both were out of this world! Wow! Thank you!

ixbhugOQGUtIrwOUYdbySA.text: Best taco I've had in my entire life. And I've eaten a lot of tacos. I had the buffalo cauliflower taco- the soft corn tortilla shell is unlike any other taco shell at any other taco joint. Also got the ground beef rice bowl which was full of flavor and the meat was tender, lean, and flavorful. Also incredibly fast service. Five stars

Qf-fgBB2yAw7gWUSSbhmNA.text: Best tacos in Pittsburgh. BLT is still in the "soft open" phase, but you wouldn't know it by trying their food. Their hours are just 6-9pm on weekdays as far as I can tell, but you should definitely stop by and give them a shot. Once they have a hard open, they'll be swamped.

Ur56tDdaoydUARZTlhVqRw.text: I've been wanting to try this place out for some time & finally got there today! I had a carne asada burrito  and I was blown away...it was delicious!  I love the variety of different options they offer when building the burrito.  At first bite I was overwhelmed by the depth of flavors going on...I couldn't wait for the next bite lol.   Lastly what totally took my experience over the top the owners and staff could not have been nicer people! Made my day!!! I will definitely be back and highly recommend this place!

EDIUjd3YRmYQXD8HXhPi9Q.text: We've been eating tacos in Pittsburgh for YEARS. A friend who lives in Bloomfield suggested we eat here and we jumped at the opportunity to put another taco place on our list. Baby's did not disappoint! Definitely one of the top taco places in the 'Burgh. A lot of options, reasonable prices for the portions, and attention to detail! Not many taco places focus on local produce or make their own pickles... will most certainly return to Baby's any time I find myself in Pittsburgh again!

YPFXX0V0e93_waDh0SgGRQ.text: Outstanding joint all around. My favorite part is their rice and beans - like wow - usually that stuff is just filler, but here, it's often times the highlight of the burrito for me; it's tender, flavorful, savory *muah*. The protein is always yummy too and the vibe is  Owner is great - funny and friendly. Rest of the food is good all around.

FoHcGj5KapynoRGzqKDEoA.text: This place is a cute little find but it doesn't have really any seating area so consider where you are going to eat before going there. I ordered a burrito and it was really nice that they don't charge extra for avocado. The salsa and beans they put inside the burrito were fantastic as flavorful but at some points I felt like I was eating plain rice inside a burrito which took away from it. Overall a great place to try but there are better tacos and burritos in Pittsburgh for sure.

fV5rwzBSfQ5GSXF9AcMeww.text: A solid taco joint in the heart of Bloomfield.  Every taco is carefully made.  Excellent, tasty ingredients.

Z6xhAd6JVmI7W6tz2BfCTg.text: I know how this might come across, but these are the best tacos I've had in my whole life. My son is 13 & he and his friends agree. We do a chef's choice kind of vibe and have tried so many new things since. We feel very happy to have such a place. I'm going there now because I'm in Bloomfield & it's all good!

Pvh9MoCRytI26u19q99T7g.text: Finally got to try this place after hearing nothing but good things. Friendly staff, fresh ingredients, overall some of the best tacos I've had in Pittsburgh. The buffalo cauliflower taco was amazing!

Bfkb2MptKW95AOIswRFuAw.text: Not enough can be said about Baby Loves Tacos. This location doesn't have seating, it's hot on the inside, but the service is incredible (the nicest people you'll ever meet) and the food was solid. Tacos, burritos, bowls and salads are the essence of this establishment and if you're in to some tasty Mexican food with American flash, get there sooner than later.

4o-ZAtRxbEt6Dl4_uSnkNA.text: First time visiting this spot!  Friendly service, quick, fresh ingredients, and nicely favored. Had the BBQ Mushroom, Chicken, and Roasted rosemary potato (special) tacos - all delicious. 3 for $10.

s40hB_mtxLSUhADcdRzmMg.text: Freaking awesome. So happy to have this place like 500 feet from my house.   Stopped in on a hot night for the pop-up and was not disappointed. Tried one fish taco, one beef and one chicken. Every one was amazing with the perfect amount of spice. The fish was the best -- next time I would get all three as fish. Fresh, no fishy-taste and perfectly fried. The toppings just made it even better.   The owner, Zach is awesome and really friendly. You can also tell he is working so hard -- when we were there he was doing it all and still making conversation with everyone that came in. I'm excited for this place to officially open but at the same time I don't want the secret to get out too much!   Reasonably priced, delicious, quick and close by -- I'll be back a lot!

K-cZ5qNzdWNPwUdskGT7pw.text: This place just didn't do it for me at all. To my taste it was grease and no flavor. Just not good

wxcgo90z0y56YimFk3Fy4Q.text: This place is so much better than Chipotle. Just tried it for the first time today and loved the tacos! The guys working were really cool too. I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

sefsQ2756wdxPBeK3MM5lA.text: Amazing tacos; tried the bbq mushroom, chorizo, brisket, and chicken - all very good.   They're just starting out and are already miles above everything else. It's so hard to find good Mexican food here, but not anymore

yFfG4yi3uaYhCeAmiBqrRg.text: There are many things to love about BLT, but the first is not even about their tacos (which are amazing). The first time I came into the shop-- it's located inside Jim's Wraps and Salads in Bloomfield-- I was greeted warmly by Steve, who runs the counter and genuinely connects with everyone walking into the place, asking their names and learning more about how they found out about BLT. He also recalls the regulars by name and helps promote a sense that this is a neighborhood restaurant that cares about its patrons. It's personal touches like these that set BLT apart and truly embody the essence of "Pittsburgh nice" (which is totally a thing).   I ordered a chicken taco and a side of guac and chips, and all were completely delicious and had the authentic Mexican flavor I was hoping for. My only reasoning for not giving it a full 5 stars is due to the wait, since it's a small set-up and during peak hours-- I went right after 6pm when it had opened-- lots of people are waiting for their tacos to be prepared by Zach, and this can take nearly 20 minutes. On the flip side, Steve is there to talk with everyone who comes in and helps you forget about the wait time entirely!  The shop runs on a donation basis, if paying with cash, or you can use a card and indicate how much you are paying. I love this idea and feel like it again embodies the sense of it being a family-style neighborhood staple that you want to be generous towards in order to keep it going.

XQi2F5HEJJ_18-_nr1EMNA.text: Amazing tacos, adorable decor, and really great and friendly owner. It'll be a weekly taco spot for me.

d61BqwzJCPgjQl2cUVBbDw.text: Location: 1.5/10. The entire establishment is about the size of a large office cubicle. Standing room only with a little bar top type area where you can eat. I went with the take out route since I like sitting and eating. One thing that sucks is that there isn't a nice park nearby where you could eat outside in the summer months.  Price: 7/10. For 10$ you get three large tacos that are densely packed. Pretty good bang for your buck. Appearance of the Taco: 4/10. Let's just say these tacos look far from gourmet but I've seen worse. You can judge for yourself from the picture. Taste: 5/10. This is where I was extremely disappointed, after following them on Instagram I saw that over the last week they have continuously sold out of tacos like they were tacos from the gods. I honestly didn't think they were that good. They were large and Densely packed but the taste just wasn't there. The best part was the hot sauce that I had asked for. If it wasn't for the hot sauce I think it would of fallen in the 3.5 out of 10 range. One note, I do love the addition of the lime. Like the little citrus kick there.  Overall rating: 5/10.  Would I go back yes, would I go out of my way to go back, no I would not. Maybe I am spoiled when it comes to tacos but it just wasn't there for me. The hype did not live up to the actual thing. As it stands the best tacos in the city of Pittsburgh in order: 1. Tako 2. Smoke 3. Bakersfield 4. Condados 5. Baby loves tacos 6. Doce taqueria.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GL8bzkAU4p2Tv6Oag6aFVA.text: Very friendly folks running the place.  However I wasn't a big fan of the tacos.  I ordered a brisket taco and I swear the chef must have used a whole jar of chili powder to cook the meat.  That was the only thing I could taste in the taco.  It was overpowering.   Maybe the chicken or veggie would be a better option next time.  As one of the few counter service places in Bloomfield I'm willing to give it another try.  But steer clear of the brisket unless you like your meat extremely (and I mean extremely) seasoned

oK3s3PgpYOzSnwsrjsOb2Q.text: I have lived in Bloomfield for two years now and have always hoped for a good taco place to move in. I was thrilled to hear one was moving into the space previously occupied by Jim's Wraps and Salads, which didn't last long. I stopped by one of their soft openings with my boyfriend and we got the chorizo and pulled pork tacos. They were fantastic. The pork had such a nice complex flavor with cumin and cinammon, with nice big slices of avocado. The chorizo was bright red and full of flavor, perfectly spicy all on corn tortillas. The owner was very nice and I like how he fixed the place up, knowing what it used to be. We will be back again very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo tacos.

Y5X54UyhK2t0zdc8IBl7sg.text: This place is amazing, the food is mouth watering, the staff is amazingly kind, and Zack the owner is such a kind hearted person, les kids eat on him, I go there regularly and I didn't even realize I used to play soccer with him till he turned his back and I saw him. I come here literally 2 to 4 times a week. And I'm writing this review because I can't get enough of this place and other people deserve to know just how amazing it is. Thanks Zack I appreciate you

BOBBt7wvu0_-R2XgazZZPw.text: Absolutely brilliant food. The vegetarian options are some of the best non-meat meals you can find in Pittsburgh.

IhpSnaPO0-eDOauhe1SsrQ.text: Absolutely delicious! The menu options are limited, just tacos, burritos, chips, but simple is always better, right? The prices are good, the portions perfect, and of course everything tasted wonderful. The salsa had a bit of a kick to it, which was unexpected but really nice. It's standing room or take-out only, with catering available (and honestly, I'll be keeping that in mind), it's bright and friendly and the staff were nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GWCoWy0_fmwtqim8vtrKAw.text: Was not expecting much, I never try to allow myself that luxury anyway. But I must say this place has really good tacos. A lot of veggie options, actually more than meat ones. Good toppings, love the radishes. Chicken, Carne Asada, and chorizo are only meat options.  May want to add a barbacoa or carnita soon. It's take out only so be prepared to find a spot to eat elsewhere because the fabulous smells will drive you crazy. I will go back again my chorizo burrito was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Asada taco

LuZNajURLcMxJ6nEne9uaA.text: This absolutely breaks my heart.  I wanted to love this place.  I was born and raised in central California, so I basically have hot sauce for blood and I'm sure at least one organ is actually a burrito.  Here's how my experience went down.   Reading the wall menu, the dude at the counter becomes obviously annoyed at me not knowing immediately what I wanted.  (Awesome.)  I ask what the veggie special is and he points to another sign.  HEY PITTSBURGH, USE YOUR DAMN WORDS.   I forget that it's really cool to be uppity for no reason around here, so I move on.  I blurt out something resembling an order and wait.   I dive into the burrito in my car because I just got off a 13 hour shift and damn it, I deserve a car burrito.   Bite one. HOLY.  %*$@!!  This is the best tortilla I have had since leaving CA.  I'm getting really pumped.  Next bite.  WOOOAH this Smokey hot sauce is damn good, DAMN GOOD.  Third bite. Plain white rice.  Ok odd choice whatever.  "BBQ mushroom"...crunch.  Ouch.  Mushrooms shouldn't have mega crunchy parts.   No extra charge for guac...because it tastes like green water.  The only positives were the tortilla and the chipotle hot sauce.  The rest was incredibly disappointing.   I'll deal with uppity people in the food world if the product is damn good.  I thought I'd give it another shot, but the fact of me running to the toilet as soon as I got home is going to prevent that from happening.

xj0mw_c6xFUmO1juMJI88w.text: No idea what I'm missing.  Certainly have had better tacos in the area (bull river, doce, edgar's, Bakersfield,  Condado) just to name a few.    My chorizo taco was fantastic.  My chicken and roasted carrot ones were ok but nothing worth traveling for or compared to multiple other places.  As for my girlfriend's meal, she ordered a salad with chicken and her chicken was not pulled or shredded,  it was just a giant piece of somewhat tough thigh or breast.  What?  Lastly, I know most of the business is take out so this shouldn't matter, but spring for some AC.  It felt 110 degrees when we were in there.  Update, the owner reached out and due to his great customer service I am definitely going to give them another try.  I love local business and wish them the best and will certainly update when I try again.  Not for me, but clearly others dig it.  I guess difference of opinion makes the world go round.

J-1IoZY_9xhHRPu082LYIA.text: Fantastic taste! Staff is delightful and really helpful. The brisket was heaven in my mouth and the spice was just right. I can't stand too hot or spicy and the taco came right out perfect. Really affordable for the exquisite taste!

eeFBrrHnY5H2LHw81SKavA.text: These tacos are pretty messy but the perfect level of spice! They're definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Messy tacos!
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside the building

kLv6lGGEhZ9L44sUjPYrJg.text: This place is everything that is right with restaurants. Nice people great food. The menu is simple but always very tasty!

v_rYqtsHBuE96iMUbQfXnQ.text: My husband and I moved to PGH from San Francisco 2 years ago and searched high and low for a good taco spot in our new town- we were so relieved to come across Baby Loves Tacos. The owners are amazing and the tacos are incredible. We go here at least once a week, sometimes twice. It's that good. Pittsburgh is so lucky to have this spot!! Highly recommend!

KlryzYXhCQpLF_ZM7viBlQ.text: I had a breakfast burrito that was so good I got emotional. Yes! This place is awesome and the people are great too!

gShEvwWp9QwlNJez2IUycA.text: Best tacos in the burgh. You can bring both veg heads and picky meat eaters here and they will leave with a super satisfying food baby. It's more of a grab and go style joint so get yourself some tacos then go for a stroll in Schenley, if you can wait long enough to devour them that is

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Y8SeaRfStNMaQr-RFzyojw.text: Love love love Baby Loves Tacos.  I can't imagine a hipper place.  No place to sit, order your tacos and either take out or there is space for about eight people to stand and munch.  I don't know why anyone would mind that when the tacos are so good.  There are only six tacos to choose from, and I always think that when a shop makes a choice to limit a menu that way it's brave but really smart.  Brave, because of all the people who think they need more choices.  Those people are missing out because a limited menu allows the chef to really lean in and excel on a smaller list.  And sure enough, each of the tacos that came out were exceptional.   I had a chorizo, brisket, and barbecued mushroom.  They all were great but I have to say the mushroom taco flavors simply exploded for me.  The veggie options all looked incredible.  Baby Loves Tacos is really one of the more vegetarian friendly places around--50% of the offerings were veggie.  Respect.  Baby Loves Tacos is worth an extended trip to get there.  Don't let this pass you but.  Support Baby Loves Tacos!  PS. how can this be rated $$?  Three tacos that fill you up for $10.  That is a deal.

rquaXfFaQ0D14QlT_iK-xA.text: Amazing tacos. Great flavors. Good vegan & gluten free options. No seating. Friendly service. Messy to eat, lots of napkins required

cM7dkf6rd5HpAgHC4iuxAg.text: Absolutely my favorite tacos in the Burgh. I love all the veggie options they have. My favorites are the adobo carrot, buffalo cauliflower, and potato. I do wish they had seating, but I usually just walk across the street and get coffee at crazy mocha. Such a positive place with amazing tacos! I stop every time I'm near Bloomfield.

BHtf3ixXvspAc55vnOX5Pw.text: Nicest people, amazing food. Out of the approximately 1032 times we have eaten here, not a single thing has been disappointing or anything but top-notch. And as a parent, I really apppreciate the name of the restaurant and the fact that kids eat free. Why are you still reading this? Go get some tacos from BLT!

tirfaskdC8c68-Ib2cWhtA.text: I think this place is great.  They season their meat so well here and definitely do not skimp on the spice. So far I have been here twice.  The first time I got a carne asada burrito which was delicious.  This time I got the tacos.  Two were brisket which is not on the menu but they said I could have their leftover catering meat.  I think they should just add the brisket onto the menu because it was the best of the two meats I got. The third taco was the carne asada.  All three tacos were delicious especially after a night of partying!  I would highly recommend stopping here if you're driving down liberty.  The people who work here are super friendly and with the great food to boot I have no problem dropping an extra couple of dollars into the tip jar.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4EOV8DUYt7KKLsuNpD7x_Q.text: I'm so glad Bloomfield is now home to Baby Loves Tacos.  They're open limited hours until occupancy license and other red tape is cleared. I left a tip that the hours now are Tuesday 6-9pm. It's actually daily unless shop is closed to work an event. Definitely a take away joint but there's counter seating for three. It's a small walkup space and that's a-ok with me. Decor is fun and makes me feel like I'm in the chef's personal kitchen. So on this visit we had tacos. Next up for us will be bowls, salads, burritos and chips/salsa. I had the chicken taco, Brian had a mushroom taco and a fish taco and we shared one made of chorizo. This food absolutely blew us away!!! So delish, you guys! I love that we were asked if we liked our food spicy and when we said yes just the right amount of hot sauce was added for the perfect kick. My chicken taco came with avocado, homemade pico, cheese, and cilantro. Mushroom taco had barbecued mushrooms and cheese. Fish taco came with a creamy chipotle sauce, pickled cabbage and avocado. Chorizo had cheese, pico, avocado, cilantro. All served on corn tortillas. Reasonably priced-comparable to other local taco spots.  I sat there literally getting dizzy and my head was spinning because the flavors were that overwhelming tasteful. It was difficult stopping myself from ordering more. The owner/chef and his mom are super nice, friendly and we got to talk about the business he had in Philly and all he plans to do here---he's opening a place in Bellevue too. Definitely worth checking out. Trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

C4oyB-XKXagIo8b7PFGVdw.text: Stopped by for lunch later in the afternoon and it wasn't crowded. Very brightly colored place with lots of sunlight. The menu wasn't overwhelming, yet still had many options that felt like you could truly get a unique taco, salad, or bowl. We decided to get the three taco deal (can't remember how much, but it was a reasonable price). There were tons of options for the meat and you could load it up with all kinds of toppings. The tacos were absolutely fantastic. They must put a hint of Chipotle sauce in the taco, but it really added the perfect flavor to the brisket and the chicken. Highly recommend. I must also mention that Kat was very friendly, shared the story of the place, and helped us order the perfect taco. Thanks!

0_e6HL4ZPMtZ8DwvpRYLrg.text: The burritos are delicious . Only thing I do t like are the hours they are open . But after having a long talk with the owner when I picked up my lunch I understand . Having kids and a small business is time consuming and being a busy mother myself I totally get it . With that said , the food is fresh, flavorful and the place is well kept and clean . Definitely coming back here again and again !

HiQdssda2x1JBDTcZcIAew.text: I'll start off by saying I'm really not a taco person (que the freakout). Idk I just need more, aka pizza. But I still enjoy a good taco when I find it. And I found it. They were at an event I was attending and so I grabbed a beef and a fish taco. Coming from someone who hasnt had a ton of tacos, I thought they were incredible. My issue is that the place isn't really open, it's sort of open but not and a lot of times they say they will be fully open soon, but then soon comes and it's still not really open. That's the only reason I went down a star.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meat and fish tacos

_z0aWssw7lLzmJEPWHuj2Q.text: We came here after wanting some tacos but not wanting to wait at Condado on a busy Friday night. We were SO glad that we ate here instead. The tacos and ingredients were so fresh and tasted amazing. Everything was reasonably priced and we loved the salsa! They were out of queso when we went, so we can't wait to go back and try it!

4EQBTkw4gpdbGst_uLIKCQ.text: I've been eyeing up Baby Loves Tacos on social media for months... today I finally got myself there to try! (It was the buffalo cauliflower taco that pushed me over the edge to drive to Bloomfield!)  The small shop doesn't offer seats but has some standing area to enjoy your tacos. I ordered the buffalo cauliflower and a chicken taco to try two different kinds (tacos are 3 for $10 or 1 for $4). Both were very good! While ordering I heard my two favorite questions... "Do you want guac? and Would you like it spicy?" Yes and YES!   The quick trip was worth it - they were spicy, flavored well, and the cauliflower was a great change! I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 3 tacos for $10
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

stIkZigcoslosU9lg7kH7Q.text: This place was pretty good. One thing I wasn't aware of is that there is zero seating in the restaurant so take out is your only option. Figured I had to go with the tacos given the name of the place, got the 3/$10 which I thought was a pretty good deal. They had 4 vegetarian options and 4 meat options, something for everyone. I had the buffalo cauliflower, carne asada and chorizo. You then have a lot of great options as far as dressings (cilantro, red slaw, jalapenos, etc.). One thing that I did not like was how greasy the proteins were, all three really. The tortillas just kind of fell apart because of the grease. Not a big deal, make sure you have a fork because if not I'd imagine things would get rather messy. But good flavors overall. Added the chips and salsa for $3, their salsa has a pretty nice kick to it. Staff was friendly. Worth checking out for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ftci0CJ-q3KCAcAmMZ2wGg.text: I really wanted to love this place. It has a cute set-up and the pics of their tacos looked great but for some reason I wasn't hugeee on them. They were a little too liquidy and runny for me, where eating them became a little stressful. I got a chicken taco and bbq mushroom one. Neither were bad by any means just not great. The flavors for the mushroom one were good but still just too messy. Good guac though!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VvbddesgUAoScqkBRXdxwg.text: It isn't a traditional taco place and more of an interpretation of filling tacos. Don't expect a taqueria and think more fusion. We stopped in to get three tacos each. The fillings were slow cooked with care, pronounced flavors and great blend of ingredients.   The tacos are quote large. You can definitely eat two and be full.   Tip, not much seating, just grab and go for optimal enjoyment. Vegetarian options are available.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iXLDx2AsL8nl8vJkzm2ZHw.text: Just call me baby bc I am in love with your tacos the service is always a 10/10, the food tastes like it was grown and picked on the same day and all the flavors mix together to create the best quick Mexican meal you could find in Pittsburgh! Also the queso is to die for. The end. Stay beautiful.

T3OLQdpMrPGNBTS98AdFVw.text: I'd say the tacos here are pretty decent! As others have mentioned, there is limited seating but if the weather is nice it's the perfect kind of food to enjoy on a bench or curb nearby. One of my least favorite things about Baby Loves Tacos is that the carne asada is not really carne asada. The meat is extremely ground up for some reason even though the flavor may remotely resemble carne asada. They have a lot of interesting toppings, but I got possibly too many of the pickled toppings and made the burrito taste way too acidic. All in all, BLT is a nice alternative to Chipotle if you're feeling a little more adventurous, but I'd still choose Chipotle 9 out of 10 times.

6q-IPeTLrNm514Ud_IjWDA.text: Baby Loves Tacos is now officially open. They opened 1-9-18. The only way I recognized the place was that they had a small folded sign near the door. They are in the process of changing the overhead sign.  When I went in I met Ryan the owner and asked him about that closure of the business I read in the paper about a week or so ago. He explained to me that matter had to do with an occupancy permit and there are no health violations associated with this business.  This place is basically a take out but they have a counter where you can stand if you prefer to eat in. I learned that they do catering both private and corporate. The menu isn't expansive but the prices are reasonable.  Ryan explained to me that everything except the burritos are gluten free and if you are a vegan, upon request, they can turn their vegetable taco into vegan. He suggested that I try 3 different tacos for my first visit. I went with the spicy brisket, the chicken, and the buffalo cauliflower. For my drink I ended up with a "lime aid." Needless to say it was very good.  I got my food fairly quickly and then I noticed how many people poured in here just for lunch! These tacos were very good. The brisket was just a little tough but otherwise I enjoyed them. Let me also mention they were messy so I was grateful that they gave me plenty of napkins. It should be noted that under the main counter they have hooks where you can hang your purse. Made it convenient for me so I wouldn't mess it up while eating.  I wasn't at the window counter so I can't speak for that one.  Although they have other offering including salads you have your choice of the same five meats or vegetables to choose from. I was glad to have found this place. It is located on Liberty Ave in Bloomfield near Tessaro's. Paid metered parking is available or off street day parking if you are lucky to find it is available as well.  I was told they are open weekdays for lunch and dinner only. They are closed on Suns. Looking forward to trying out their other offerings on a future visit. Good food and great service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stand up only. Place is booming
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo cauliflower taco
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken taco

0YPdvRs0GjrnPculMvIsRg.text: Have been wanting to try this place for a while as I am always on the lookout for the best tacos in the burgh. Even though it was raining out, there was a line for their tacos. I did the 3 for $10 and had the buffalo cauliflower, chorizo, and chicken with guac. Their menu is pretty limited, but with the amount of people there I knew it had to be good. There is no seating, but my friend and I were able to grab some space at the standing counter area. The decor of the place is cute with a lot of succulents and candles giving it a warm homey vibe.   The tacos were delicious. I love corn tortillas, so I was happy that their tacos each come with two corn tortillas. They load up the tacos with toppings such as salsas and cheese and give lime on the side. The buffalo cauliflower had a nice kick to it which I was not expecting. The chorizo was on the oily side, but tasty. After three tacos, I was pretty full. A perk was that the guac was no extra cost. Overall, a great place to grab some quality tacos. You truly can never have enough tacos. I will definitely be back to try some different proteins!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Both of our tacos!
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cute plants all around
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos with guacamole!!

MwAmdmiW7yGMW4OzKxs5mg.text: Fresh quick easy and most of all super delicious!   If your hungry for a taco or burrito you MUST go here!

0b4VgDV53K3N1VkH8Qm0nQ.text: These tacos are amazing!!! Apparently the've only "soft" opened and their full opening is coming. Don't be discouraged when the sign outside says "Jim's wraps and salads".   I had one brisket and one bacon taco. Neither of these meats are traditional, but the taco style (double corn tortilla, cilantro, salsa, lime) was. I AM STILL THINKING ABOUT THE BACON TACO and my only regret was not ordering 2 of those along with the brisket. If you're hungry, I suggest you order 3 tacos. The tortillas were super delicious, and tasted fresher/softer than normal corn tortillas-- I'd love to know where they get them.   The owner is very kind and informative. He even told me to "pay what I want" and when I said $10 for two tacos (which I thought was reasonable) he only charged me $6 for the two.  I can't wait to come back and bring my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon taco ~$4
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One bacon, one brisket taco, ~$4 each

t02jZOaSTGo1gS5GeRbJXw.text: The tacos were so filling and yummy.  My fiance and I live north of the city and happened to be in the area to finally try them!  Make sure to get to this place early!  They make everything fresh and will close when they run out of ingredients.  Haha we found this out the first time we attempted to eat there towards the end of their work hours.  I went with the 3 tacos for $10.  My tacos were filled separately with chicken, chorizo, and carne which was all super tasty.  My significant other went with bacon, buffalo cauliflower , and chorizo which was also really good.  We were able to add whatever toppings on it all for the same price "except for the guacamole if I remembered correctly."  They do not skimp out on their meat!   Totally worth the trip. Also the people who work there are super sweet

QztyF1gE-r79Y6O6qpXqjw.text: Delicious. We love everything on the menu--especially the bbq mushrooms and buffalo cauliflower. If the chicken soup is on the menu, do yourself a favor and order extra. We've also used BLT for catering large and small events and everything is always perfect. On time, more than enough food, reasonably priced and always a crowd pleaser! Plus the owners are stellar humans.

aMpCZQ0pk25Cnv-UuEjxkw.text: We have followed the Baby Loves Tacos Instagram account for a while now, and finally got to try.   The staff was very friendly when we entered and helped us right away. We came during brunch, so they were offering breakfast tacos/burritos. We ordered burritos with bacon. We were offered OJ "with a twist," meaning they added mineral water to the juice.   The breakfast burritos were really good and huge! They were filled with cheese, beans, potatoes, and pico. They came out quickly and were very filling. I would definitely go back!  It was clear that this place has tons of regulars already as many other customers were greeted by name. The staff was willing to explain anything and were very attentive.   While we were there we learned that they are still in their soft opening phase- so they are running on donations. They accept cash or card.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Cl5JRY0T1pvQYtptrH7M4A.text: Love this place for their inspired burritos and friendly service, but the last two times I stopped during hours advertised as open, they have been closed (including Friday 6:30 p.m.).  What gives, Baby?

kcsob3pVP5Tj1p97D_lN9g.text: Meh. Been here a few times, not feeling it  Presentation is cute but I'm here for taste and everything was just kind of bland  There's other places in the city to find decent tacos, look elsewhere

K-UdCmOgYLDsh18YaF4vDA.text: I love the concept and the food. I like that the spot is fun and easy to get to. The owner Zach is funny and following his instagram really makes me want tacos every day of the week. I will say that I wish there were stools by the window ledge. I like the stand and eat feel but if this is going to happen can we get some hooks under the ledge for my purse. It just was weighing me down and I would have liked to be able to move just a bit more and take up less ledge space by plopping it down next to me.   They are not truly open yet but I look forward to them being 100% ready and up and running. Everything I have tried has been awesome. I cannot wait to taste more of the menu as Zach changes it per week.   Also as per my usual taco complaints this place ACTUALLY uses corn tortillas. I love it! Cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips

K1gRJE1dDdrYGDdeVFynuw.text: Man, this Baby Loves Tacos and the tacos at Baby Loves Tacos.  Have stopped by in the past but they were not open at the time I stopped due to just starting up and not having consistent hours during soft opening.  Finally open hours are listed on the website.  Yea!   Also, finally have signage.   Tried the 3 for $10 taco option.  Can't go wrong with any.  The Spicy Brisket just came out of the oven and was perfect.  The Chorizo was also tasty with a nice spicy flavor. The chicken was good but not as spicy.  If you are in the area and looking for a fast meal and tacos you should definitely stop in.  The tacos come with salsa, cilantro, lime, fresh tomato and you can get gauc.

DAIJrU42KZBTIP35Njf3Tw.text: I'd heard the rumors. Baby Loves Tacos came back home from Philadelphia and had been setting up a pop-up for a while. "You have to go check it out." "It's worth the drive for such a legit taco." "I've been craving Baby Loves Tacos for weeks since I last had it."  The rumors are True and Baby Loves Tacos lives up to the hype. You have to go check it out. It's worth the drive for such a legit taco. And, since trying it for the first time last week, I've been craving Baby Loves Tacos ever since.  We stopped in for the soft opening, and everything blew us away--we were particularly impressed by the sweet potato taco. The full menu will have burritos and bowls and most of my paycheck. Bloomfield is a great place for Italian flare, but an even better place for Baby Loves Tacos. As an added bonus, Zack is passionate and super nice and humble about how awesome his food is.  There are tons of places in the city to hop on the new taco craze, but there's only one Baby Loves Tacos. And Baby Loves Tacos is drivin' me crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Joseph Loves Tacos

jXeMUYBY5589G9vsreBDcA.text: My buddy lives upstairs and was concerned I haven't tried this yet, so we made it happen. I'm saddened to have waited this long. I ponder how much better my life would've been had I had a BBQ mushroom taco sooner. I tried apologizing to the owner for not taking this long, 'i made a mistake' i told him...his piercing glare of disgust penetrated my soul and I haven't been right since...I will make it up to you Baby Loves Tacos...you have shown me the path and your Open sign...sleep well, we will be together again soon...soon

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q9ZtjjeoK5GwYzm5Nx6UlQ.text: The best tacos I have ever had.  Highly recommend the bbq mushroom tacos.  Steak and chicken were great too.  All fresh ingredients and it shows.  High quality!  I'm from out of town and may not make it back but I hope the city of Pittsburgh supports this small business.  Keep up the good work!

8Z2SCSlJCMLeRp1Di4oAwA.text: Baby Loves Tacos is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. I found out about the location originally from social media and I could not wait to visit. I was hooked after the first time! Since then, it has become a frequent stop for me for a late lunch or dinner. I always get the 3 taco meal - and although I am a total carnivore..I am obsessed with EVERY one of their veg options for tacos. I usually end up with 3! The buffalo cauliflower is a must-have if you are only picking one veg option. I also love the mushrooms, carrots, and sweet potato [if available]. The brisket is also out of this world if it's available. You cannot go wrong with any filling though, truly! Follow their Instagram to stay up to date - because everything is SO fresh and made daily, sometimes certain things sell out.   It is extremely apparent that this business is a labor of love and passion from the owners. They are so thoughtful and intentional with every ingredient they offer  - and that is something I appreciate so much in a food service establishment. I have to eat GF and I can rely on Baby Loves Tacos for a quick, amazing, GF-safe meal, every time I go...and that is pretty major. A bonus is that the owner and his family are so nice - and the owner's mom often works the register and gives off the friendliest mom vibes! 5 Stars from me! 100%.

78dsnpx0xFLDkYt6Tp4rJA.text: This could be one of the best tacos I've had in Pittsburgh, let alone ever. No lie. I'm kicking myself for not coming here sooner! It is a teeny tiny spot with no seating, just a window to order some wickedly good tacos and eat in your car like a slob... I mean, that's what I did. I have the stains to prove it.   The nicest guy ever was behind the counter and suggested I just trust him and he put together three tacos for me to try. I had the mushroom taco, which could have been my favorite... But maybe a tie with the chorizo and then the carne asada, which was also tasty. I believe some of the toppings were pickled onions and cheese. My mouth is watering just thinking of them!   I cannot wait to go back and will make this at least a monthly routine. I don't care if I have to eat them in my car and stain more clothes, it's happening!

mwkeuS_qirphl8OPOsANjA.text: Parking: It's not actually that bad in Bloomfield. You might have to pull a quick u-turn to find that right spot but you're not going to run into a situation where you give up out of frustration.  Service: It's a small establishment with just two workers on this particular day. We showed up before any rush! Quick service all around!  Facilities: You can tell that there is a bit of a makeshift counter that they put in place. I'm certainly not one to judge considering the end product! There is really no available seating for patrons and most of their business is really just walk up. We managed to find an opening at the small picnic table just outside.  Food: Delicious! The nachos were on POINT and the carne asada burrito was legit.  Would absolutely visit this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos with Chicken
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Asada Buritto
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iSjUr8Gp_4npP75YUMqdLg.text: Tasty food. Good Service. Great Vegetarian Options. Inexpensive.   BLT is my favorite taco shop in Pittsburgh. All of the components are top-notch - from the protein to the produce.   I love the bowls and salads, but the tacos are delicious as well. And the portions are HUGE for the price (it is heftiest street taco I've had).

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco three-way: fish, chicken and steak

W8h5OtvBs0XJtBpzNFgm-g.text: So glad to have stopped in at this casual, funky little spot in Bloomfield. These were some of the best tacos I've had, I tried all of the meat options and love the customizable fresh toppings they offer. There's a bench outside and some standing spots inside but otherwise take it to go. If you haven't been here and love tacos, make sure to put this on your list. When we went, they were just chopping up some fresh pork belly and it stole the show although eat taco was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mhNOlFw4Q-70NUmTBFglsA.text: Baby Loves Tacos is the perfect grab and go spot. I couldn't decide between the three meats they had so I got three tacos with ONE OF EACH... cod, carne asada, and chicken... each better than the last. They were loaded with fresh ingredients and absolutely delicious.  It's a very small joint with only room for two to sit out front if the weather is nice (we lucked into those seats). You basically walk-in order and take your food to-go. It's beyond reasonably priced (they LOAD those tacos up). I plan on coming back, again and again.

v73D9fTG5KLYbYvH0NitJw.text: I stopped by here this past Saturday afternoon with my wife for lunch.  We happened to be in the vicinity of Baby Loves Tacos whenever I remembered seeing it right on Liberty in Bloomfield.  So we headed on over without knowing what to expect.  Whenever we entered the space I was surprised by the fact that it was much smaller than I expected.  The whole inside consisted of a place to order your food and then a standing food bar that could fit maybe 6 people tightly.  Other than that there were some chalkboard menus up that showed you your choice of proteins and toppers and that's about it.  For lunch on this day I decided to go with the 3 tacos while my wife went with a carne asada burrito bowl.  I chose a different protein for each of the tacos and went with the BBQ mushroom (ports & oyster), Buffalo cauliflower and Chicken.   Then for the toppings I decided on hot salsa, pickled red slaw, cheese.  All of my tacos ended up being pretty good and I think out of the bunch that the BBQ mushroom was my favorite because it had a good texture along with a nice smokiness to it.  That's not to say that the other two weren't good as they both were and I have to admit that I was impressed with the number of vegetarian options (4) that they offered.  In any case I also thought that the hot salsa added a nice little spice to the tacos while the slaw added some extra acidity.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Both my wife and I really enjoyed our tacos and so I plan on bringing my dad here for lunch some afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ mushroom (ports &amp; oyster), Buffalo cauliflower and Chicken Tacos

wjpeCgHLGyVSRG83cbj6lg.text: I don't even have to eat my taco yet to give this place a 5/5 stars. The people were extremely welcoming for first comers.  The smells were amazing, they had brisket out on the smoker that radiatented (is this a word? I just made it up but you'd understand if you smelled the deliciousness of this place). Fresh ingredients, decent prices, great presentation.   .. alright, so we all just tasted my brisket taco. I'm not even sure what exactly is on it because I told them to make me whatever, but the taste is fire!! The meat, the sauce.. the radishes.. dayuuuummm on my taste buds. Will definitely be back here... will update when my friends eat their tacos!   Also to note, they have a pay it forward wall.. you can pay it forward for someone who can't afford to pay, or be gifted with a free meal. Awesome idea.. and awesome people. We were so impressed with the staff here, the customer service and the chill atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YiL7UNpwXskkWrnDK90t4Q.text: Pretty good yummy tacos! Pretty close to authentic Mexican tacos just the shells seem different. The meat was flavorful and seems fresh. Everything seemed fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne chicken and meat special
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baby loves tacos

k6W4zYVyIbDrqsJ8fCUJYA.text: This is a grab and go eatery. There is no place to sit and enjoy your food. There is a small standing rail about six feet long you could stand and eat. They have vegan and vegetarian tacos. The mushroom tacos are delicious! It is kind of hard for the cooks to hear you because of the window set up.

9yaMeHzOJ-tukysM4BGtxw.text: Such a cute little taco shop!  It's not big enough to eat in, but perfect to get tacos to go!  They have a number of vegetarian friendly and meat options!  It's set up like an assembly line so you can pick and choose what you want on your tacos as you go.  I personally think that the purple cabbage made the tacos! The worker making my tacos also recommended a combo of their sweet potato and bacon taco which was da bomb! You can tell that this is a small business that really cares about their service and product and I am happy to support them!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

g5NSiL9EaD1Gg8AsiHfkhw.text: Okay I am obsessed with this place. I'm gluten and dairy free, but they have amazing options and I was able to work with it! Not only is the food SOOOOOOOO good, but the workers are amazingly nice and just so great. I wish I could give them more than 5 stars. I didn't have a chip in my card, and they couldn't figure out how to make it work w the square reader, so they gave me the food for free, said it was on them and they like to pay it forward. Wow I mean, doesn't get much nicer than that. They are absolutely incredible and I'm so happy we have a place like this in Pittsburgh! GO HERE! Not only is the food so great, but everyone is friendly and happy to help you. I will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nZwgZJOga_YO5x6jou5hTw.text: Do you like babies and love tacos? Do you love tacos and are nonplussed about babies? Never fret. Babies Loves Tacos as much as I do and their delicious and stirringly high quality ingredients have me wondering when will the Tacos love the baby back?! Stay tuned.

y5mUhSiyuIPZoH09gZfaBg.text: Best tacos in pittsburgh! The ingredients are super fresh, and tons of vegetarian options. The space is small, so I would say it is more of a take out spot, rather than a sit down place. The guys that prepared the tacos were awesome, and very generous with the toppings! Tonight I had the spicy cauliflower, BBQ mushroom, and a mix of carrot/sweet potato tacos ($10 for 3) I also got some extra guacamole which was a little up-charged. I am stuffed, and I will return!!!! (Evil laugh)

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh ingredients kept in clean area
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $10 for three tacos, Hugh quality great flavor

atuNVu6zJa6F_q6yr4isWQ.text: Joshua loves Baby Loves Tacos.  Such friendly and chill people own and run this spot.   The food was tasty and beyond reasonably priced.  Good luck, you guys, and I'll be sure to stop by again when I'm in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Jh4FZT-UAhqDRW1CleUG2g.text: I really wanted to like Baby Loves Tacos more than I did. I've been searching for a great taco place in Pittsburgh ever since moving here, and I'm not sure yet if Baby Loves Tacos makes that cut or satisfies that need. I got the chorizo, carrots, and buffalo cauliflower, while my wife got the mushrooms, carne asada, and chicken. We were also excited to see that they had guacamole that day, so we jumped on that offer and grabbed some (with chips!). We took our food to-go, but we could have found some counter space had we decided to stay.  Pros: - the filling options were very unique, and the tacos were packed to the brim - the veggies were delicious, especially with he addition of the pickled veggies (I can't remember what those were exactly). I'm generally a big meat eater, but the veggies were filling and satisfying - the food is clearly super fresh - the menu is completely flexible for different diets. They handled gluten free and dairy free without any problems  Cons: - the corn tortillas and tortilla chips aren't made in the store, which was a let down and detracted from the taco experience - the guacamole was good, but the size was disappointing for the cost, and the chips were pre-made and didn't enhance the guacamole - despite double layers of tortillas, the filling bled through all of my wife's tacos, making them very soggy, so she struggled to eat them normally  Overall: I'm definitely going to give Baby Loves Tacos another chance, if for no other reason than having more of the delicious veggie fillings. I might try a bowl or salad next time and avoid the tortilla issues altogether. Overall, a solid spot that I will visit again, but the search for the best tacos continues...

lx21apr4jxwlg32kNFgrkw.text: After hearing my friend rave about this place, we finally went yesterday and it was so delicious! The small storefront doesn't have seating but that doesn't stop the traffic flow. People came in before and after us. I ordered the three tacos for $10. One chorizo, one chicken, and one carne asada (grilled and sliced beef). The chorizo was my least favorite mainly because of all the grease, but it had pretty good flavor. The chicken however was my favorite. Perfectly grilled and with good flavor. The carne asada was decent, I probably wouldn't get it again. All added ingredients I got on each tasted delicious and fresh including the cilantro, pico de Gallo snd jack cheese. I know some people are like: why would you go to a taco place that has 'tacos' in the name for nachos? But I feel like these nachos would be fire so I'm gonna do me next time I walk into this little charming taco stand.

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Asada, Chicken and Chorizo Tacos. 3 tacos for $10

G5-gaf4tkne72hZWnYQ2Eg.text: I slide through weekly. This place is small, yet mighty! Great vegan and vegetarian options. My meat eating boyfriend even opts for the veggies!  Roasted carrot,  buffalo cauliflower, and rosemary potato are my go to in a taco or burrito. They sometimes even have breakfast for dinner!  YUM! It's a small, family owned business that is constantly perfecting every detail. Follow them on Instagram because sometimes they sell out. I definitely don't see this as a negative thing!  To me, it means they strive for freshness. Keep up the good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Qrcqbd0RfHnY-eZYuikm3g.text: Glad I finally stopped here. I'm not a vegan but the cauliflower Taco was the best of the bunch and the other two (Chicken & Carne Asada) we're

photos.caption: Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The cauliflower Taco... man was it outstanding. The chicken was flavorful as was the carne asada. I got them spicy and they were on point.
Photo of Baby Loves Tacos - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacoa

Sm-cyB2bfhNLb2-CbM4mQg.text: I strolled into Baby Loves Tacos this past Saturday for lunch after realizing it'd been far too long since I had a good taco.  I've seen friends post rave reviews about this place so I'm glad I finally got to try it for myself!  First things first, I didn't expect it to be so cozy inside... and when I say cozy, I mean this is a grab and go kinda joint. No tables for dining in, unless you opt to stand at the counter in the window and enjoy your tacos - which we did.  We were greeted warmly by two gentlemen who enthusiastically explained the two specials (one meat and one veg) as well as the other menu offerings.  Carnivores and vegetarians alike will find something to love here!  Three tacos and an order of carne asada nachos seemed like a good way to fill up the tank and try a decent variety of the menu.  The tacos are served in warm, double-shelled corn tortillas which is always a treat.  Especially when an establishment is as generous with packing in the fillings as Baby Loves Tacos.  First up was a chicken taco:  the chicken was tender and seasoned well.  Next was the carne asada, which was by far my favorite of the lot.  The meat was delicious, juicy, and had just the right kick of heat.  I was definitely glad we opted for the carne asada on our nachos too, because it was just that dang good. Last but not least, a buffalo cauliflower taco because why not?!  Also excellent.  The cauliflower was cooked to a perfect level of tenderness and full of flavor.   I truly hope these folks have plans for a sit-down spot in the future, as they stand out among the endless taco options popping up around town. Until then, I'm happy to oblige to their delicious grab and go format!

tR2cTD8eQazJ7KKGRZYnnQ.text: Loved the huevos rancheros, the brisket chili, the arroz con gandules and pernil for PR fundraiser.

DT5vCqVBNociL8i_FeUQ7Q.text: First visit to BLT.  Mostly take out but there is a little space to stand at the counter. We will be back!  Six different fillers for tacos, burritos, bowls or salads. Very fresh, very restricted diet friendly IMHO. Easy to go gluten free or veg but don't know about strict allergy limitations. Super friendly atmosphere and quick service at 7:30 pm Wednesday. Hubby had the chicken and brisket tacos; I had the spicy! Chorizo, cauliflower and mushroom ones. Mushrooms were my favorites for sure. Easy public parking for a dollar on Taylor St one block up (take a left at the light from Liberty driving away from downtown Pittsburgh). Guacamole w chips a nice way to wait the few minutes for your food. Add to your order!

ygH8XhgUHEzYqSjtW8JjKg.text: I can't speak to the food yet. I've been wanting to try this place for many weeks and tonight I braved the rain and miserable weather just to try this place for dinner. Closed. Dark. No sign except the sign saying they open for dinner on Saturday at 5:00. Nothing on the website either (which I checked before driving across town on this fruitless adventure). I'm very disappointed. At least post a sign or something if you aren't going to open during advertised hours!

gDi9UuScep4Z5TSJny199w.text: This little neighborhood place doesn't even have a sign yet, and the hours are irregular. But don't let that stop you. My zucchini and cauliflower soft tacos were absolutely amazing---flavorful and delicious. They compare well to tacos I've had in bigger cities and fancier restaurants. Last bite was as good as the first, and left me hungry for more. We will definitely be back the next time we're in town.

ZjbTopPxUJ-A5KX9tJ_lXQ.text: This place is great- everything is always so delicious and fresh and the portions are pretty filling, especially the burritos. I also appreciate how hands on the owner is- he genuinely cares about his customers and it shows every time I'm there( which is pretty often). The buffalo cauliflower is my favorite and their hot sauce is amazing. It's pretty hot though, so I make sure to get it on the side. This place is worth waiting for!

YQi0pliKfgSqWfv5wtY9iA.text: Okay so I have eaten at the majority of taco joints in Pittsburgh, and I love tacos. But this place is amazing. Their tacos are definitely some of the best I have ever had, if not the best, but on top of that they are super friendly and consistent which puts them on top of everyone else for me. It feels like you are eating at someone's family's house. I love this place.

80A7_AyazeXd3uBZtsjCaw.text: Great tacos! Nice guys very accommodating. I loved the buffalo cauliflower taco nice and spicy. I will be back to try the burrito.

EEBIxXXrX2sqfTvWJ_6pUQ.text: A fantastic spot! The owner seems super passionate and makes amazing tacos! Strongly suggest the beef and chorizo tacos! Can't wait for the full opening!

btM44qwRSyWSJnCEG_8VUg.text: The kind of place where you plan your next visit before you even leave. Passionate chef, delicious food. Check it out!

b9U5qcUBMbFxRQ5ghdRLeg.text: I've anxiously awaited the arrival of Baby Loves Taco in Bloomfield for the past few months... and it was even better than I imagined! The ingredients are fresh, the tacos are creative and plentiful, and the owner is awesome. What more can you ask for?? We will be back regularly. With empty bellies!
